alert.note: Alert for Las Vegas Valley; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 05 at 2:31AM PST until March 05 at 8:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph expected. For the western Las Vegas Valley, gusts up to 60 mph will be possible during the morning hours. * WHERE...The Las Vegas Valley and the Spring Mountains. * WHEN...Through 8 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Strong downslope winds could result in tree and power line damage. Brief power outages may result. Unsecured items or structures may be blown away or damaged. Roof and shingle damage may occur. Travel may become difficult for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...During the early to mid morning hours today, the western Las Vegas Valley could see sporadic gusts of up to 60 mph including Summerlin and Red Rock Canyon. These winds could result in structural damage or power outages. Winds will remain gusty through the afternoon in these locations but not as severe.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Las Vegas Valley; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon
